channel.title: Stealing RSWebclients' jar for your personal use
channel.description:
I posted this in Web-Dev because it's all website based, the only RSPS based is the jar itself. Step 1: Sign-Up for RSWebclients.com and set up your server stuff. Step 2: Go to your server's page where you can play the game (this has the jar on it). Should look like: http://www.rswebclients.com/play/YOURSERVERNAMEHERE Step 3: Right click the webpage and click view source. Step 4: Find the div with a class off "applet" and copy [b]THE WHOLE DIV[/b] I'm using SilentPVPs because they're #1 on the site and I'm not a registered user. It will look like below, but with your details in it. [code]
[/code] Step 5 [Optional]: Download the jar and put it on your website, this keeps the link. Step 6: save the copied code (after you changed everything) and create a simple html page for it. Step 7: Upload the page (And the .jar if you want) to your website. -If you downloaded the .jar make sure the archive link is valid. Step 8. Enjoy. Ending Notes: You can get in trouble with rswebclients for doing this. If you use my method and do get in trouble, it was all your fault. Remember, you're stealing.

item.title: Stealing RSWebclients' jar for your personal use
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:16, topic:519480”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=637943.msg4300971#msg4300971 date=1368984990]

Don’t you know how to make your own jar client? :L

No. I can only write html 4.1 dur hur I doesn’t know java.
[size=1pt]yes, i can. this is for the community[/size]
[/quote]

Making a client involves 0 programming though.[/quote]
I have -1 programming though.

Read full topic

item.title: Stealing RSWebclients' jar for your personal use
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:12, topic:519480”]In all seriousness they’re a wreck of a community. I registered, posted on their judge a programmers skill thread where everyone was rating retards 10/10 saying that I doubt that anyone on that community would be above a 2/10 and got banned from their admin. Absolute shambles.

znSJ0ZP.png1024×600
[/quote]
It really doesn’t surprise me. I don’t expect a community based on hosting jar files to be all that good. Considering that community would be filled with skiddy’s that can’t program a rsps worth a shit.
#BeingOffensive.

Read full topic

99% of the reason of why I made this: Bored.

item.title: Stealing RSWebclients' jar for your personal use
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I posted this in Web-Dev because it’s all website based, the only RSPS based is the jar itself.
Step 1:
Sign-Up for RSWebclients.com and set up your server stuff.

Step 2:
Go to your server’s page where you can play the game (this has the jar on it).
Should look like: http://www.rswebclients.com/play/YOURSERVERNAMEHERE
Step 3:
Right click the webpage and click view source.

Step 4:
Find the div with a class off “applet” and copy THE WHOLE DIV
I’m using SilentPVPs because they’re #1 on the site and I’m not a registered user.
It will look like below, but with your details in it.

<div class="applet"><applet style="" name="client" width="765" height="503" archive="https://dl.dropbox.com/u/73573851/Jar/DeathlypvpzV4.jar" code="client.class" title="Java(TM)"><param name="serverName" value="SilentPVP"></applet></div>

Step 5 [Optional]:
Download the jar and put it on your website, this keeps the link.

Step 6:
save the copied code (after you changed everything) and create a simple html page for it.

Step 7: Upload the page (And the .jar if you want) to your website.
-If you downloaded the .jar make sure the archive link is valid.
Step 8. Enjoy.

Ending Notes:

You can get in trouble with rswebclients for doing this. If you use my method and do get in trouble, it was all your fault. Remember, you’re stealing.

Read full topic
